false_positives.title: Complex function with high cyclomatic complexity
false_positives.description: The `format_file_in_place` function has high cyclomatic complexity due to multiple nested conditionals and exception handling paths. This makes it difficult to maintain and test.
false_positives.recommendation: Refactor the function into smaller, more focused functions with clear responsibilities to improve readability and maintainability.

false_positives.title: Inefficient string concatenation in line formatting
false_positives.description: The `__str__` method of the Line class uses string concatenation with repeated appends, which can be inefficient for large line contents due to string immutability in Python.
false_positives.recommendation: Use `io.StringIO` or `join()` method to build strings more efficiently, especially for complex formatting operations.

false_positives.title: Potential race condition in cache update
false_positives.description: Multiple processes could modify the cache simultaneously when running in parallel mode, potentially leading to inconsistent cache state.
false_positives.recommendation: Implement proper locking mechanisms or use atomic file operations when updating the cache to prevent race conditions.

model_response.summary: The codebase is a sophisticated Python code formatter similar to Black. The code is well-structured with a clear separation of concerns between CLI parsing, formatting logic, and AST manipulation. No critical security vulnerabilities were found. The code quality is generally high with proper type hints and documentation, though some functions could benefit from refactoring to reduce complexity. Performance is optimized with parallel processing and intelligent caching. Error handling is comprehensive. The code follows Python best practices and integrates well with standard tooling.

bugs.title: Complex function with high cyclomatic complexity
bugs.description: The `format_file_in_place` function has high cyclomatic complexity due to multiple nested conditionals and exception handling paths. This makes it difficult to maintain and test.
bugs.recommendation: Refactor the function into smaller, more focused functions with clear responsibilities to improve readability and maintainability.

bugs.title: Inefficient string concatenation in line formatting
bugs.description: The `__str__` method of the Line class uses string concatenation with repeated appends, which can be inefficient for large line contents due to string immutability in Python.
bugs.recommendation: Use `io.StringIO` or `join()` method to build strings more efficiently, especially for complex formatting operations.

bugs.title: Potential race condition in cache update
bugs.description: Multiple processes could modify the cache simultaneously when running in parallel mode, potentially leading to inconsistent cache state.
bugs.recommendation: Implement proper locking mechanisms or use atomic file operations when updating the cache to prevent race conditions.

nitpicks.title: Inconsistent naming for function parameters
nitpicks.description: Parameter names like `ctx` and `loop` are inconsistent with the general naming convention in the codebase. More descriptive names would improve readability.
nitpicks.recommendation: Use more descriptive parameter names like `context` and `event_loop` to improve code readability.

nitpicks.title: Missing type hint for return value in format_file_contents
nitpicks.description: The `format_file_contents` function is missing a return type hint, which would improve code clarity and tooling support.
nitpicks.recommendation: Add a return type hint `-> FileContent` to clarify the function's return type.

nitpicks.title: Inconsistent docstring formatting
nitpicks.description: Docstrings have inconsistent formatting with some using triple quotes and others using single quotes, which affects readability and consistency.
nitpicks.recommendation: Standardize on single triple quotes for all docstrings to maintain consistency across the codebase.
